alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:21PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimball and southwestern Banner Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Albin, or 18 miles northwest of Kimball, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
